alert.note: Alert for Allen; Chautauqua; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 31 at 3:33PM CST until February 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...A wintry mix Tuesday evening will transition to snow after midnight Tuesday night. Periods of moderate to heavy snow will be possible Wednesday into Wednesday night. Snowfall amounts of 6 to 10 inches are possible with locally higher amounts. Only a very light glaze of ice is possible during the transition from rain to snow Tuesday evening. * WHERE...Portions Southeast Kansas. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will become difficult and hazardous. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 10 below zero Wednesday night into Thursday morning could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near white out conditions are possible across southeast Kansas on Wednesday into Wednesday night, due to heavy snowfall and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
